info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 07 at 1:00PM CDT until August 07 at 1:45PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Morristown has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Bradley County in east Tennessee... Southeastern Marion County in east Tennessee... Southern Hamilton County in east Tennessee... * Until 245 PM EDT/145 PM CDT/. * At 200 PM EDT/100 PM CDT/, a severe thunderstorm was located over South Pittsburg, or near Bridgeport, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Chattanooga, Cleveland, Jasper, Signal Mountain, Kimball, Ridgeside, Harrison, South Cleveland, Red Bank and Collegedale. This includes Interstate 75 in Tennessee between mile markers 1 and 20. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT/600 PM CDT/ for east Tennessee. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
